cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 125 mi SSE of Nassau and 325 mi SE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest tonight, then turning north-northwest and paralleling the Florida east coast before curving toward Georgia/South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida east coast (likely between West Palm Beach and Cape Canaveral)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Chokoloskee to Suwannee River along the Florida Gulf Coast (includes Tampa Bay/Manatee area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Deerfield Beach to Fernandina Beach along the Florida east coast and the Bahamas archipelago
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast from Deerfield Beach northward, with indirect impacts possible across the Florida peninsula and Gulf Coast watches
weather_observation.wind: Outer bands could bring sustained tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 kt) with occasional higher gusts to the Manatee County Port area late Thu night into Fri.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge inundation expected on the west-central Florida coast from Matthew’s current track.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain may drop 1–3 inches locally, enough to cause brief ponding but not widespread flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Choppy bays/seas and strong rip currents inside Tampa Bay; periodic lightning within rain bands could disrupt cargo handling.
